problem_text:
Let us consider the class of groups with n generators and m relators. A sub-
class of this class is called dense if the ratio of the number of presentations of the
form ⟨a1, . . . , an | R1, . . . , Rm⟩(where |Ri| = di) for groups from this subclass to the
number of all such presentations converges to 1 when d1 + · · · + dm tends to infin-
ity. Prove that for every k < m and for any n the subclass of groups all of whose
k-generator subgroups are free is dense.
A. Yu. Olshanskii
answer:
This is proved (G. N. Arzhantseva, A. Yu. Olshanskii, Math. Notes, 59, no. 4 (1996),
350–355).
